comments:
Eclipse SDK i20050308
Eclipse CDT Runtime 2.1

81555).

(In reply to comment #0)
> During startup, got the following NPE, caused during a preference change. 
Note
> that I had no C projects, only Java projects (this seems to be triggered by 
bug
> 81555).

Exactly !!! 8-) 8-) 8-)

See below.

> !ENTRY org.eclipse.core.runtime 4 2 2005-03-08 17:17:16.373
> !MESSAGE Problems occurred when invoking code from plug-in:
> "org.eclipse.core.runtime".
> !STACK 0
> java.lang.NullPointerException
> 	at
> org.eclipse.cdt.internal.ui.text.CTextTools.adaptToPreferenceChange
(CTextTools.java:231)

....
> 	at
> 	at org.eclipse.cdt.ui.CUIPlugin.getTextTools(CUIPlugin.java:372)
> 	at
> org.eclipse.cdt.internal.ui.editor.CDocumentSetupParticipant.setup
(CDocumentSetupParticipant.java:33)
> 	at
> org.eclipse.core.internal.filebuffers.TextFileBufferManager$2.run
(TextFileBufferManager.java:248)
> 	at
....
> 
org.eclipse.jdt.internal.ui.javaeditor.CompilationUnitDocumentProvider.createFi
leInfo(CompilationUnitDocumentProvider.java:840)
> 	at



So the JavaEditor is trying to get the DocumentSetupParticipant and
instead of getting its own it gets .. the C/C++ one ...

Because we use "*" for the CDT in the extension point.
For C++, file extensions are not the only way to identify a C++ file
what about iostream, map, container, fstream, cstdio etc ...

The old way was not flexible, but now we the new IContentTypeManager
this outstanding issue was solved for us.
Get a newer build, use the 3.0 version they work with Eclipse-3.1Mx

http://download.eclipse.org/tools/cdt/builds/
